_header: Let love to love go kindly and soft
_description: On the nature of love — eight quatrains

BodRawD913.First Lines:
lett lowe to lowe go kynly and sowfte for lowe with howtt lowe
                    canot be bothe …
BodRawD913.Last Lines:
…so mott that be blesset al loverd do pray[ ] the gret god of
                    lowffe in thr tarnall Iohe
BodRawD913.Editions:
Frankis,  P. J. 
             “Some Late Middle English Lyrics in the Bodleian Library.” 
             Anglia
         73 (1955): 299-305: 300.

BLAdd18752.Note:
f. 85 = st. 1-2, 4-5, 7-8; and f. 84v = st. 3, treated as
                    separate poem.
BLAdd18752.Editions:
Reed,  Ernest Bliss. 
             “The Sixteenth Century Lyrics in Add. MS. 18,752.” 
             Anglia
         33 (1909): 344-69: 356.
